name: Barbie Cali Girl Horse Pacifica
description: Gorgeous Mattel Barbie horse released in the early 2000’s. The horse has a beautiful soft mane and tale. The head and neck are articulated as are the knees and shoulders/hips. The horse can stand straight up but doesn’t hold the pose very well. I’m not sure if the back knee joints have become loose due to use or whether the horse was always like this. Comes with saddle, stirrups and reins. Measures 11in. tall (measures from the tip of ears with head up).

name: Cat Doll Kit
description: Hand sculpted ceramic and cloth doll kit. Made-to-order. Makes one lovely little cat doll, approximately 19 to 20cm tall. Boxed kit includes ceramic head, a set of paws and feet, some calico cloth, wool stuffing, easy to follow pattern and instructions (4 illustrated pages) postcards for inspiration. All you need are pins, sewing needles, thread, pencil, scissors, and anything you like to dress/costume your doll.

name: Chow Chow
description: Here comes a rare find; Steiff Chow Chow, named ‘Blanco’, a mohair dog that Steiff produced in this largest size (35 cm / 13 ¾ inches from the middle of his head to his bent hind leg) only from 1928 to 1931. Once this mohair dog was produced by Steiff as a mascot for ‘Zeppelin’, after the image of a real dog – 1928 when the big airships had their heyday, the German airship ‘Graf Zeppelin’ made its first trans-Atlantic flight. When it went back to Germany a Chow Chow puppy named ‘Vedool’ was on board, a gift from American friends to the flight Captain. The little dog became the mascot not only of this airship journey, he flew quite a lot in his time and became very popular and even caused the Chow Chow to become the fashionable dog of the 1930s.

name: Dancing Bunny
description: Duracell dancing Bunny toy 1990’s vintage boxed in a good condition and working with music playing , move and dance , funny , music samba de janeiro.

name: Dollshouse children’s bedroom furniture - red and white
description: Vintage OAKLEAF dollshouse children’s bedroom furniture - red and white - 1:16 scale - fits Lundy or Barton houses. Vintage de los 70. Materiales: wood, cotton, foil, cardboard, metal, velvet. This children’s room in red and white by OAKLEAF (original from the 70s) would make a great addition to your dolls house. Both the single bed and the chest of drawers are covered in white and red check cotton, complemented by a stool with white legs and a red seat. There is also a wardrobe, and a book-cupboard which has a chalkboard quite reminiscent of Lisa furniture.The set is 16th scale and in played with but overall good vintage condition. The wardrobe’s doors can be opened. The drawers are only for show. The mirror on the wardrobe is made from reflective foil, the door knobs from metal, the stool cover from red velvet, and the chalkboard is made from thick cardboard. Everything else is made from wood.

name: Elephant on Wheels
description: The Holy Grail of Steiff ancestors! An early Steiff elephant on wheels with some beautiful custom touches... Goldknit cloth with birds on top and real bone in shape of elephant teeth, ears and tail are also custom made. A really beautifull and unique stuffed animal pull toy from the early 1900’s. A museum toy with artistic touches that will take your collection to the next level. Approx Height: 35 cm Approx Length: 40 cm

He has brown legs, yellow ear inner sides, brown ear backs and black eyelashes

description: When this plastic push toy is pushed or pulled, three comical childern with different color hats and litho faces pop up making different whistling sounds. The toy has been well loved and there are plenty of scratches on the wheels and some paintloss on the wooden handle.
